[[collective]] of autonomous [[Clandestine cell system|cells]].<ref name="gordon"> *{{Cite conference |first=Uri |last=Gordon |authorlink=Uri Gordon |title=Liberation Now: Present-tense Dimensions of Contemporary Anarchism |booktitle=Thinking the Present : The Beginnings and Ends of Political Theory |date=27–28 May 2005 |location=University of California, Berkeley}} *{{Cite journal |last=Thompson |first=Stacy |title=Crass Commodities |journal=Popular Music & Society |issue=3 |volume=27 |date=October 2004 |pages=307–322(16) |url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m2822/is_3_27/ai_n6330582 |accessdate=2007-07-08 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080101051714/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m2822/is_3_27/ai_n6330582 |archivedate=January 1, 2008 |doi=10.1080/03007760410001733152 |deadurl=yes |df= }} *{{Cite web |url=http://www.athensnews.com/issue/article.php3?story_id=28894 |title=Melee breaks out uptown at end of anarchist confab |accessdate=2007-08-01 |last=Ludwig |first=Mike |date=2007-07-30 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928130453/http://www.athensnews.com/issue/article.php3?story_id=28894 |archivedate=September 28, 2007 |work=The Athens News |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> CrimethInc. emerged in the mid-1990s,<ref name="faq"/> initially as the hardcore [[zine]] ''[[Inside Front]]'', and began operating as a collective in 1996.<ref name="thompson">{{cite book |last=Thompson |first=Stacy |title=Punk Productions: Unfinished Business |publisher=SUNY Press |pages=109 |location=Albany |year=2004 |isbn=0-7914-6187-4}}</ref> It has since published widely read articles and zines for the anarcho-communist movement and distributed posters and books of its own publication.<ref name=brandt>{{cite web |last=Brandt |first=Jed |url=http://burning.typepad.com/burningman/2006/03/crimethinc_is_i.html |title=Crimethinc: In Love With Love Itself |work=[[Clamor (magazine)|Clamor]] |accessdate=January 14, 2008 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5eW0gRYrS?url=http://burning.typepad.com/burningman/2006/03/crimethinc_is_i.html |archivedate=February 11, 2009 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
CrimethInc. cells have published books, released records, and organized national campaigns against globalization and representative democracy in favor of radical community organizing. Less public splinter groups have carried out direct action (including arson and [[hacktivism]]), hosted international conventions and other events, maintained local chapters, sparked riots, and toured with multimedia performance art or hardcore [[anarcho-punk]] musical ensembles. The collective has received national media and academic attention, as well as criticism and praise from other anarchists for its activities and philosophy. CrimethInc. has an association with the North American anarcho-punk scene due to its relationship with artists in the genre and its publishing of ''Inside Front'' as well as, more recently, the contemporary anti-capitalist movement.
==Activities== Activities by CrimethInc. cells have toured with hardcore [[anarcho-punk]] musical ensembles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://media.www.dailycampus.com/media/storage/paper340/news/2002/10/08/Focus/Punk-Show.Rocks.Student.Union-292057.shtml |archive-url=https://archive.is/20110708221434/http://media.www.dailycampus.com/media/storage/paper340/news/2002/10/08/Focus/Punk-Show.Rocks.Student.Union-292057.shtml |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2011-07-08 |title=Punk show rocks Student Union |accessdate=2008-07-24 |last=Patterson |first=Jesse |work=The Daily Campus |publisher= |date=2002-10-08 }}</ref> In 2002, a cell in [[Olympia, Washington]] staged a five-day film festival with skill-sharing workshops and screenings.<ref>{{cite news |first=Ross |last=Raihala |title=The heArt and Film Festival |url= |work=[[The Olympian]] |date=2002-12-12}}</ref> Cells have also supported various large-scale campaigns with publicity work, including the "[[Unabomber for President]]" and the "[[Don't Just (Not) Vote]]" election campaigns as well as the protests against the [[Free Trade Area of the Americas]] of 2003 in [[Miami, Florida]].<ref>''Days of War, Nights of Love'' (2001) , Crimethinc.Workers Collective, p. 221 {{ISBN|0-9709101-0-X}}</ref><ref name="rev">{{cite book |last=Andersen |first=Mark |title=All the Power : Revolution Without Illusion |publisher=Punk Planet Books |year=2004 |isbn=978-1-888451-72-6}}</ref> Individuals adopting the CrimethInc. ''nom de guerre'' have included convicted [[Earth Liberation Front|ELF]] arsonists,<ref>{{cite news |title=3 plead guilty in attempts at arson |work=[[The Sacramento Bee]] |date=2005-10-15}}</ref> as well as [[hacktivists]] who successfully attacked the websites of [[Drug Abuse Resistance Education|DARE]], [[Republican National Committee]] and sites related to U.S. President [[George W. Bush]]'s [[George W. Bush presidential campaign, 2004|2004 re-election campaign]].<ref name=wired>{{cite web|url=https://www.wired.com/politics/law/news/2004/08/64602 |title=Hackers Take Aim at GOP |work=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]] |accessdate=2008-02-22 |last=Schachtman |first=Noah |date=2004-08-17 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090111015944/http://www.wired.com/politics/law/news/2004/08/64602 |archivedate=2009-01-11 |df= }}</ref><ref name=deagon>{{cite news |first=Brian |last=Deagon |title=GOP Sites Hit By Denial Of Service Attack; Hard To Tell Who Culprits Are |work=Investor's Business Daily |date=2004-10-22}}</ref> These activities have earned the collective irregular attention from the mainstream news media.<ref> * {{cite news |first=Chris |last=Whitehead |title=How do you say 'dese, dem, dose' in Chinese?; The Mayor's Office of |url=https://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-5858110.html |publisher=[[Chicago Sun-Times]] |date=2007-04-13 |accessdate=2007-07-08 }} * {{cite news |first=Sarah |last=Childress |title='Hacktivists' Log On |url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_kmnew/is_200408/ai_n6835339 |publisher=[[Newsweek]] |date=August 2004 |accessdate=2007-07-08}} * {{cite news |first=Irene |last=Sege |title=Pay phones may appear to be gathering dust, but some still use them |url=http://www.boston.com/lifestyle/articles/2008/03/10/busy_signals/ |work=[[The Boston Globe]] |publisher=[[The New York Times Company]] |date=2008-03-10 |accessdate=2008-03-16}}</ref> In 2010, several CrimethInc. cells worked in collaboration with other [[anti-capitalist]]s and [[anarchist]]s to launch international Steal Something From Work Day, which coincides with the United States [[Tax Day]].
===Publications===
[[File:Days of war, nights of love ne plus ultra edition.jpg|thumb|left|"[[Ne plus ultra]]" edition of ''Days of War, Nights of Love'', CrimethInc.'s 2001 [[manifesto]].]]
The creation of propaganda has been described as the collective's core function.<ref name="harper's">{{cite journal|last=Power |first=Matthew |date=March 2008 |title=Mississippi Drift |journal=[[Harper's Magazine]] |pages=54–63 |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2008/03/crimethinc_in_harpers.pdf |accessdate=2008-03-10 |format=PDF |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080511151948/http://www.crimethinc.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2008/03/crimethinc_in_harpers.pdf |archivedate=2008-05-11 |df= }}</ref> Among their best-known publications are the books ''Days of War, Nights of Love'', ''Expect Resistance'', ''Evasion'', ''Recipes for Disaster: An Anarchist Cookbook'' the pamphlets ''To Change Everything: an Anarchist Appeal'' (available in paper, PDF and video form) and ''Fighting For Our Lives'' (of which, to date, they claim to have printed 600,000 copies),<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/blog/2008/05/28/fourth-ffol-printing-hits-the-streets/ |title=Fourth FFOL Printing Hits the Streets |work=CrimethInc. Far East Blog |date=2008-05-28 |accessdate=2008-06-14 |author=pfm |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080601013828/http://www.crimethinc.com/blog/2008/05/28/fourth-ffol-printing-hits-the-streets/ |archive-date=2008-06-01 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> the [[hardcore punk]]/political [[zine]] ''Inside Front'', and the music of hardcore punk bands. Several websites are maintained by individual cells, including Crimethinc.com, operated by the Far East Cell, which hosts propaganda, excerpts from available publications, and a blog of the activities of other cells. CrimethInc. is connected to publishing collectives/organizations with similar ideas, notably the [[Curious George Brigade]], which has written a number of publications including ''Anarchy in the Age of Dinosaurs''. In 2005, they began publishing a half-gloss journal, ''Rolling Thunder'', with the byline "An Anarchist Journal of Dangerous Living", which released its eighth issue in 2009. CrimethInc. texts have received wide coverage in the anarchist media and in academic publications,<ref> *{{Cite journal |last=Clark |first=Dylan |year=2004 |title=The Raw and the Rotten: Punk Cuisine |journal=Ethnology |volume=43}} *{{Cite book |last=Doy |first=Gen |title=Picturing the Self |publisher=I. B. Tauris |location=London |year=2004 |isbn=1-85043-413-1}} *{{Cite journal |last=Edwards |first=Ferne |author2=Mercer, David |date=November 2007 |title=Gleaning from Gluttony: an Australian youth subculture confronts the ethics of waste |journal=[[Australian Geographer]] |volume=38 |issue=3 |pages=279–296 |publisher=[[Routledge]] |doi=10.1080/00049180701639174 |url=http://www.informaworld.com/smpp/content~content=a783694781~db=all}} *{{Cite journal |last=Dunne |first=Stephen |first2=Eleni |last2=Karamali |first3=Stevphen |last3=Shukaitis |year=2005 |title=Inscribing Organized Resistance |journal=Ephemera |volume=5 |issue=4 |pages=562–567 |issn=1473-2866}}</ref><ref name=gndr>{{cite journal |last=Nicholas |first=Lucy |date=Spring 2007 |title=Approaches to Gender, Power and Authority in Contemporary Anarcho-punk: Poststructuralist Anarchism? |journal=ESharp |issue=9 |pages= |issn=1742-4542 |url=http://www.gla.ac.uk/media/media_41219_en.pdf |accessdate=2008-04-07 |format=PDF}}</ref> and have been used as reading materials for university courses on anarchism.<ref>{{cite journal |last=Conger |first=Chloe |url=http://daily.stanford.edu/article/2002/4/29/studentLeadsCourseOnAnarchy |archive-url=https://archive.is/20070429184048/http://daily.stanford.edu/article/2002/4/29/studentLeadsCourseOnAnarchy |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2007-04-29 |title=Student leads course on anarchy |accessdate=2008-07-24 |journal=[[The Stanford Daily]] |date=2002-04-29}} </ref>
===Convergences=== {{quotebox| |align=right |width=15% |title=Convergence locations |quote= * [[Des Moines, Iowa]] (2002) * [[Louisville, Kentucky]] (2003) * Des Moines, Iowa (2004) * [[Bloomington, Indiana]] (2005) * [[Winona, Minnesota]] (2006) * [[Athens, Ohio]] (2007) * [[Milwaukee|Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] (2008) * [[Pittsburgh|Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania]] (2009) }}
Since the summer of 2002, CrimethInc. has hosted annual conventions, termed "convergences", open to anyone. Typically featuring the performances of traveling theatrical troupes, musicians, direct-action and [[mutual aid (politics)|mutual-aid]] workshops from individual participants, the few-days-long camping trips have attracted coverage in newspaper articles,<ref name=gouss/> initiated multiple [[Reclaim the Streets]] actions, mobilized large [[Critical Mass (cycling)|Critical Mass]] events, and catalyzed many other activities.<ref name=ao7/>
The 2007 convergence in [[Athens, Ohio]], saw an impromptu [[street party]] which resulted in arrests on minor charges.<ref name=gouss> {{cite web |url=https://www.athensmessenger.com/news/anarchist-answers-to-riot-charge/article_c3e000d9-93b2-5248-b16e-ff2867b0d4e3.html |title=Anarchist answers to riot charge |work=Athens Messenger |accessdate=2008-02-22 |last=Goussetis |first=Elizabeth |date=2007-07-31 }} </ref> ''The Athens News'' characterized the convergence as "a sort of networking, resume-swapping opportunity for would-be radicals, free-thinkers, [[Levellers]], [[Diggers]], [[Neo-Luddism|Neo-Luddites]] and other assorted malcontents."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.athensnews.com/news/local/good-going-you-left-town-for-the-summer-and-missed/article_fbdcc78d-64dd-5cff-b2e0-8d368406181a.html |title=Good going; you left town for the summer and missed everything |publisher=The Athens News |accessdate=2008-02-25 |last=Phillips |first=Jim |date=2007-09-04 }}</ref> It is typical of these gatherings to require that all attendees have something to contribute to the momentum: whether it is bringing food or equipment to share, leading a discussion group, or providing materials with which to write to [[political prisoner]]s. There has been a pattern of promoting convergences as festivals, reminiscent of barnstorming [[flying circus]]es and travelling sideshows.<ref name=ao7>{{cite web|url=http://www.infoshop.org/inews/article.php?story=2007073009151431 |title=Athens, Ohio: Police attack Crimethinc conference |work=Infoshop News |publisher=[[Infoshop.org]] |accessdate=2008-04-28 |date=2007-07-30 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110523102836/http://www.infoshop.org/inews/article.php?story=2007073009151431 |archivedate=2011-05-23 |df= }}</ref>
''[[Harper's Magazine|Harper's]]'' journalist Matthew Power described the 2006 convergence in [[Winona, Minnesota]] as follows: {{quote|text=Several hundred young anarchists from around the country had train-hopped and hitchhiked there to attend the annual event known as the CrimethInc Convergence...Grimy and feral-looking, the CrimethInc kids squatted in small groups around a clearing....[they] were in the middle of several days of self-organized workshops, seminars, and discussions, ranging from the [[mutualism (economic theory)|mutualist banking]] theories of the nineteenth-century anarchist philosopher [[Pierre-Joseph Proudhon]], to an introductory practicum on lock-picking, to a class on making one's own menstrual pads .... CrimethInc's adherents had come together there because they wanted to live their lives as some sort of solution. They saw 'the revolution' not as a final product but as an ongoing process; they wanted not just to destroy the capitalist system but to create something livable in its place.<ref name="harper's"/>|sign=Matthew Power|source=''[[Harper's Magazine]]'', March 2008}}
These convergences have been hosted by different groups within the collective each time, typically based on the initiative of local enthusiasts. Every year a different set of policy requests is released from locals in the field, typically encouraging a sober, consensus-based space in which no financial transactions are made. The one firm rule has been "No police informants," a regulation which has been ignored by the [[FBI]]. Information gathered by FBI informants at CrimethInc. convergences (in 2004, 2005, and 2008) contributed to the convictions of [[Eric McDavid]] and his associates, as well as [[2008 Republican National Convention]] protester Matthew DePalma.<ref>http://www.startribune.com/local/stpaul/41070787.html?elr=KArks:DCiUtEia_nDaycUiD3aPc:_Yyc:aUU {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110607063219/http://www.startribune.com/local/stpaul/41070787.html?elr=KArks%3ADCiUtEia_nDaycUiD3aPc%3A_Yyc%3AaUU |date=2011-06-07 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/TheLaw/Conventions/story?id=5718900&page=1 |title=Michigan Man Accused of RNC Molotov Cocktail Plot |author=ABC News |work=ABC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://static.kovr.viacomlocalnetworks.com/~kovr/affidavit.pdf |archivedate=2007-01-11 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070111192140/http://static.kovr.viacomlocalnetworks.com/~kovr/affidavit.pdf |title=Confidential Source "Anna"-issued affidavit |accessdate=2008-07-21 |format=[[.pdf]] |work=United States District Court Eastern District of California}}</ref>
In 2010, CrimethInc. announced the ''We Are Everywhere'' campaign of national tours and events in lieu of the traditional convergence.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/blog/2010/06/03/august-2010-we-are-everywhere/ |title=August 2010: We Are Everywhere - CrimethInc. Far East Blog |publisher=}}</ref> In 2015, CrimethInc. embarked on the similar ''To Change Everything'' two-month tour of the United States.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/blog/2015/06/15/to-change-everything-us-tour/ |title=To Change Everything US Tour |publisher=CrimeThInc. Ex-Workers Collective |accessdate=2015-10-22 |date=2015-06-15}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.eastoregonian.com/eo/local-news/20150930/anarchy-comes-to-the-pendleton-art-center |title=Anarchists come to the Pendleton arts centre |publisher=East Oregonian |accessdate=2015-10-22 |date=2015-09-30}}</ref>
=== Music ===
CrimethInc. is associated with the [[North America]]n [[anarcho-punk]] scene because of its long relationship with notable musicians in the genre and its publishing of ''Inside Front'', a "journal of hardcore punk and anarchist action".<ref name="thompson-music">{{cite book |last=Thompson |first=Stacy |title=Punk Productions: Unfinished Business |publisher=SUNY Press |pages=109 |location=Albany |year=2004 |isbn=0-7914-6187-4 }}</ref> CrimethInc. releases include LPs, CDs, and 7"s from North American and European anarcho-punk, hardcore and [[anti-folk]] bands. Academic Stacy Thompson has described CrimethInc. as "exemplary of a more contemporary and nuanced approach" to the possible forms anarcho-punk could take to resist commodification through aesthetic expression.<ref name="thompson-music"/> However, Thompson does not consider the aesthetic choices of the collective to be substantially different from the anarcho- and [[crust punk]] bands released by fellow anarcho-punk collective ''[[Profane Existence]]'' in the mid-to-late 90s.<ref name="thompson-music"/>
==Philosophy== [[File:CrimethInc. - eclipse the past.png|thumb|140px|"Eclipse the past" inside front cover image from CrimethInc.'s ''Days of War, Nights of Love'' (2001). A philosophical theme of CrimethInc.'s writings is the rejection of the "exclusive, anti-[[subjectivity|subjective]]" nature of history, and the need to take active control of one's own life.]] {{quote |text=Crimethought is not any ideology or value system or lifestyle, but rather a way of challenging all ideologies and value systems and lifestyles—and, for the advanced agent, a way of making all ideologies, value systems, and lifestyles challenging. |sign =Crimethinc.com<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/texts/pastfeatures/purged.php |title=All Traveler Kids Purged From CrimethInc. Membership |accessdate=2008-01-20 |work=Crimethinc.com}}</ref>}} CrimethInc as a loose association represents a variety of political views; the CrimethInc. [[FAQ]] asserts that it has "no platform or ideology except that which could be generalized from the similarities between the beliefs and goals of the individuals who choose to be involved—and that is constantly in flux."<ref name="faq"/> "CrimethInc." is an anonymous tag, a means of constructing dynamic networks of support and communication within the anarchist movement, and as such anyone can publish under the name or create a poster using the logo; each agent or group of agents operate autonomously.<ref>{{cite book |last=Sims |first=Francwa |title=The Anacostia Diaries as It Is |year=2006 |isbn=1-4116-1888-2}}</ref> As well as the traditional anarchist opposition to the [[State (polity)|state]] and [[capitalism]], agents have, at times, advocated a [[straight edge]] lifestyle, the total supersession of [[gender role]]s,<ref name=gndr/> violent [[insurrection]] against the state,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/texts/atoz/antig8.php |title=Let Me Light My Cigarette on Your Burning Blockade |accessdate=2007-10-31 |work=Crimethinc.com}}</ref> and the [[refusal of work]].<ref name="vacation">{{cite web |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/texts/insidefront/permanentvacation.php |title=How I Spent My Permanent Vacation |accessdate=2008-01-13 |last=D. |first=Brian |work=Crimethinc.com}}</ref>
CrimethInc. is influenced by the [[Situationist International]],<ref>{{cite journal |last=Lang |first=Daniel |date=May 2007 |title="Give Us the Dumpsters -Or- Give Us Life": Res Derilictae and the Trash of Free Trade |journal=Cultural Recycling |volume=3 |issue=1 |publisher=[[Other Voices (open-access journal of cultural criticism)|Other Voices]] |url=http://www.othervoices.org/3.1/dlang/index.php}}</ref> and has been described by scholar Martin Puchner as "inheritors of the political [[avant-garde]]",<ref>Puchner, Martin (2005). ''Poetry of the Revolution: Marx, Manifestos and the Avant-Gardes''. [[Princeton University Press]], Princeton and Oxford. 320pp., {{ISBN|978-0-691-12260-1}}.</ref> [[Ken Knabb]] has criticized CrimethInc. for presenting simplistic and in some cases false accounts of history in their manifesto ''Days of War, Nights of Love'', and for mythologizing themselves as "a pole of international subversion".<ref> {{cite web |url=http://libcom.org/library/crimethinc-comments-ken-knabb |title=Comments on CrimethInc. by Ken Knabb |publisher=Libcom.org |accessdate=2008-02-26 |last=Knabb |first=Ken |authorlink=Ken Knabb}} </ref> For their part, the authors of the book criticized the "exclusive, anti-[[subjectivity|subjective]]" nature of history as "paralyzing", advocating in its place a non-superstitious myth.<ref>''Days of War, Nights of Love'' (2001) , {{ISBN|0-9709101-0-X}}, p. 111–114</ref> The collective has expressed a strident anti-copyright stance and advocacy of the appropriation of texts and ideas of others, which has attracted criticism from academic philosopher George MacDonald Ross as an endorsement of plagiarism.<ref>{{cite conference|first=George |last=MacDonald Ross |title=Plagiarism really is a crime:a counterblast against anarchists and postmodernists (and others) |booktitle=Plagiarism: Prevention, Practice and Policies 2004 Conference |date=2004-05-10 |url=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/228450982_Plagiarism_really_is_a_crime_a_counterblast_against_anarchists_and_postmodernists_and_others |accessdate=2008-04-07 |format=PDF }}</ref> CrimethInc.'s N©! [[free license]] is known as an example of [[copyleft]]. It grants rights to individuals and none to corporations.<ref name="Keats2010">{{cite book|last=Keats|first=Jonathon|title=Virtual Words: Language on the Edge of Science and Technology|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=sBIOXJqqVEUC&pg=PA65|year=2010|publisher=Oxford University Press|isbn=978-0-19-975290-4|page=65}}</ref>
The active participants of CrimethInc. characterize it as a mindset and a way of life first and foremost, rather than as an organization ''per se''.<ref name="faq"/> Its main goal is to inspire people to take more active control of their own lives, becoming producers of culture and history instead of passive consumers.<ref>{{cite book |author=Summerisle |title=Times of Hate, Times of Joy, Lost Highway, Volume 1 |year=2005 |isbn=978-1-4116-6506-4 |publisher=Lulu |location=Morrisville, NC}}</ref><ref name="about">{{cite web |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/about/ |title=About CWC: Index |work=Crimethinc.com |accessdate=2008-01-10}}</ref> Those who ascribe to the CrimethInc. philosophy advocate radical ways of living one's life to the end of eliminating the perceived inequities and tyrannies within society. Contributors to publications are generally not credited in respect of an anonymity asserted by participants to be one of the organization's primary values.<ref name="faq"/> The name "CrimethInc." itself is a satirical self-criticism about the hypocrisy of revolutionary propaganda (and other "margin-walking between contradictions"<ref name="faq">{{cite web |url=http://www.crimethinc.com/about/faq.html |title=Frequently Asked Questions |accessdate=2007-10-31 |work=Crimethinc.com}}</ref>) and a direct reference to the concept of "[[thoughtcrime]]" developed in [[George Orwell]]'s ''[[Nineteen Eighty-Four]]''.<ref name="faq"/>

{{short description|Reduction of the quantity of natural resources}} {{Other uses|Depletion (disambiguation)}}
'''Depletion''' is an [[accounting]] and [[tax]] concept used most often in [[mining]], [[timber]], [[petroleum]], or other similar industries. The depletion deduction allows an owner or operator to account for the reduction of a product's reserves. Depletion is similar to [[depreciation]] in that it is a cost recovery system for accounting and tax reporting.
Depletion, for both accounting purposes and [[Internal Revenue Service|United States tax purposes]], is a method of recording the gradual expense or use of [[natural resource]]s over time. Depletion is the using up of natural resources by [[mining]], [[quarrying]], [[Boring (earth)|drilling]], or [[logging|felling]].
According to the [[IRS]] Newswire,<ref>[https://www.irs.gov/newsroom/article/0,,id=120930,00.html IRS Issues Guidance on Recoverable Reserves]</ref> over 50 percent of oil and gas extraction businesses use cost depletion to figure their depletion deduction. Mineral property includes oil and gas wells, mines, and other natural deposits (including geothermal deposits). For that purpose, property is each separate interest businesses own in each [[mineral deposit]] in each separate tract or parcel of land. Businesses can treat two or more separate interests as one property or as separate properties.
==Types of depletion== For tax purposes, the two types of depletion are percentage depletion and cost depletion.
For mineral property, one generally must use the method that gives you the larger deduction. For standing timber, one must use cost depletion.<ref name="irs.gov">[https://www.irs.gov/publications/p535/ch09.html Publication 535 (2007), Business Expenses]</ref>
===Percentage depletion=== To figure percentage depletion, one multiplies a certain percentage, specified for each mineral, by gross income from the property during the tax year. The rates to be used and other conditions and qualifications for oil and gas wells are discussed below under ''Independent Producers and Royalty Owners'' and under ''Natural Gas Wells''. Rates and other rules for percentage depletion of other specific minerals are found later in ''Mines and Geothermal Deposits''.<ref name="irs.gov"/>
===Cost depletion=== Cost depletion is an accounting method by which costs of natural resources are allocated to depletion over the period that make up the life of the asset. Cost depletion is computed by estimating the total quantity of mineral or other resources acquired and assigning a proportionate amount of the total resource cost to the quantity extracted in the period. For example, if Big Texas Oil, Co. discovers a large reserve of oil, the company has estimated the oil well will produce 200,000 barrels of oil. The company invests $100,000 to extract the oil and extracts 10,000 barrels the first year. Therefore, the depletion deduction is $5,000 ($100,000 X 10,000/200,000).
Cost depletion for tax purposes may be completely different from cost depletion for accounting purposes:
:<math>CD = S/(R+S) \times AB = AB/(R+S) \times S </math> :CD = Cost Depletion. :S = Units sold in the current year :R = Reserves on hand at the end of the current year :AB = Adjusted basis of the property at the end of the current year
==Accounting== Adjusted basis is the basis at end of year adjusted for prior years depletion in cost or percentage. It automatically allows for adjustments to the basis during the taxable year.
By using the units remaining at the end of the year, the adjustment automatically allows for revised estimates of the reserves.
Depletion is based upon sales and not production. Units are considered sold in the year the proceeds are taxable under the taxpayer's accounting method.
==Reserves== Reserves generally include proven developed reserves and "probable" or "prospective" reserves if there is reasonable evidence to have believed that such quantities existed at that time.
==Example== If producer X has capitalized costs on property A of $40,000, originally consisting of the lease bonus, capitalized exploration costs, and some capitalized carrying costs, and the lease has been producing for several years and during this time, X has claimed $10,000 of allowable depletion. In 2009, X's share of production sold was 40,000 barrels and an engineer's report indicated that 160,000 barrels could be recovered after December 31, 2009.
The calculation of cost depletion for this lease would be as follows:
:Cost depletion = S/(R+S) × AB or AB/(R+S) × S :CD = 40,000/(40,000 + 160,000) × ($40,000 − $10,000) : = 40,000/200,000 × $30,000 : = $6,000
==See also== * [[Depreciation]]

==Further reading== * Shulman, Peter A., “The Making of a Tax Break: The Oil Depletion Allowance, Scientific Taxation, and Natural Resources Policy in the Early Twentieth Century,” ''Journal of Policy History'' (2011), 23#3 pp 281–322.

'''Disciplinary probation''' is a disciplinary status that can apply to [[student]]s at a higher educational institution<ref name=Knowles1977 /> or to [[employee]]s in the workplace.<ref name=Pell2003 /> For employees, it can result from both poor performance at work or from misconduct.<ref name=Pell2003 /> For students, it results from misconduct alone, with poor academic performance instead resulting in [[scholastic probation]].<ref name=Knowles1977 />
For a student, disciplinary probation means that the student is on formal notice, and subject to special rules and regulations.<ref name=Knowles1977 /><ref name=BradySnoxell1965 /> The violation of these rules may lead to more severe forms of discipline, such as suspension, dismissal, and expulsion.<ref name=BradySnoxell1965 />
For employees, disciplinary probation is one common step in a scheme of [[progressive discipline]]. It is a common replacement, in non-unionized workplaces, for the progressive disciplinary step of suspension without pay. A usual period for such probation is 90 days.<ref name=Grote2006 /> Some companies may place permanent employees on probationary status, particularly if their performance is below a set standard or for disciplinary reasons. In this instance, the employee is usually given a period of time to either improve their performance or modify their behaviour before more severe measures are taken.
==See also== *[[Probation (workplace)]]

'''Discovery-driven planning''' is a planning technique first introduced in a ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'' article by [[Rita Gunther McGrath]] and Ian C. MacMillan in 1995<ref>McGrath, R. G. & MacMillan, I. C. 1995. Discovery driven planning. ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'', 73(4): 44–54.</ref> and subsequently referenced in a number of books and articles.<ref>McGrath, R. G. & MacMillan, I. C. 2009. ''Discovery driven growth: a breakthrough process to reduce risk and seize opportunity''. Boston: [[Harvard Business Publishing]].</ref><ref>Christensen, C. M. 1997. ''The innovator's dilemma: When new technologies cause great firms to fail''. Boston: [[Harvard Business School Press]].</ref> Its main thesis is that when one is operating in arenas with significant amounts of uncertainty, that a different approach applies than is normally used in conventional planning. In conventional planning, the correctness of a plan is generally judged by how close outcomes come to projections. In discovery-driven planning, it is assumed that plan parameters may change as new information is revealed. With conventional planning, it is considered appropriate to fund the entire project, as the expectation is that one can predict a positive outcome. In discovery-driven planning, funds are released based on the accomplishment of key milestones or checkpoints, at which point additional funding can be made available predicated on reasonable expectations for future success.<ref>Block, Z. & MacMillan, I. C. 1985. Milestones for successful venture planning. ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'', 63(5): 84–90.</ref> Conventional project management tools, such as stage-gate models or the use of financial tools to assess innovation, have been found to be flawed in that they are not well suited for the uncertainty of innovation-oriented projects <ref>Rajesh, S. & Zafar, I. 2008. Stage-gate controls, learning failure, and adverse effect on novel new products. ''[[Journal of Marketing]]'', 72(1): 118. {{JSTOR|30162204}}</ref><ref>Christensen, C., Kaufman, S., & Shih, W. 2008. Innovation killers: how financial tools destroy your capacity to do new things. ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'', 86(1): 98–105, 137.</ref>
Discovery-driven planning has been widely used in entrepreneurship curricula and has recently been cited by [[Steve Blank]] as a foundational idea in the [[lean startup]] methodology <ref>Blank, S. 2013. Why the lean start-up changes everything. ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'', 91(5): 63–72.</ref>
== Five disciplines ==
A discovery-driven plan incorporates five disciplines or plan elements: # Definition of success for the plan or initiative, including a "reverse" income statement # Benchmarking against market and competitive parameters # Specification of operational requirements # Documentation of assumptions # Specification of key checkpoints
Using discovery-driven planning, it is often possible to iterate the ideas in a plan, encouraging experimentation at lowest possible cost. The methodology is consistent with the application of real options reasoning to business planning, in which ventures are considered "real" options. A real option is a small investment made today which buys the right, but not the obligation to make further investments.<ref>McGrath, R. G. 1997. A real options logic for initiating technology positioning investments. ''[[Academy of Management Review]]'', 22(4): 974–996. {{JSTOR|259251}}</ref><ref>van Putten, A. B. & MacMillan, I. C. 2004. Making real options really work. ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'', 82(12): 134.</ref><ref>Dixit, A. K. & Pindyck, R. S. 1994. ''Investment under uncertainty''. Princeton: [[Princeton University Press]].</ref>
== See also == * [[Assumption-based planning]] * ''[[The Innovator's Dilemma]]''

'''Dominique Cerutti''' (born January 3, 1961 in [[Manosque]], France) is a French businessman and has been Chairman and CEO of the [[Altran]] group since June 2015.
==Career==
=== Early career === Dominique Cerutti began his career as an engineer for French company [[Bouygues|Bouygues Construction]] in [[Saudi Arabia]], where he was based for nearly two years.
=== IBM === He moved to [[IBM]] in 1986 starting out in sales engineering and sales management. He remained at IBM for more than 20 years.
At IBM, he was promoted to his first management position in 1996 as the Director of Personal Systems Group for Western Europe.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=83421936&ticker=ICE&previousCapId=20571&previousTitle=GANNETT%20CO|title=intercontinentalexchange gro (ICE:New York)|work=Businessweek|date=}}</ref>
Over the following decade, Cerutti ascended the ranks of IBM, and worked in roles that were particularly international. In 1998, he became Executive Assistant to the Chairman and CEO, Lou Gerstner.
In 2000, he moved to IBM Global Services, the leading market services provider in Europe, first as General Manager for Western Europe and then for the whole EMEA region.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=19091455&authType=NAME_SEARCH&authToken=M0Gd&locale=en_US&srchid=2774862811395063981142&srchindex=2&srchtotal=11&trk=vsrp_people_res_name&trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A2774862811395063981142%2CVSRPtargetId%3A19091455%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary|title=Dominique Cerutti profile|work=Linkedin|date=}}</ref> He managed tens of thousands of employees in 17 different sectors.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lefigaro.fr/societes/2009/10/01/04015-20091001ARTFIG00488-dominique-cerutti-rejoint-nyse-euronext-.php|work=Le Figaro|title=Dominique Cerutti rejoint NYSE Euronext |date=October 1, 2009|language=fr}}</ref> In 2005, Cerutti became IBM’s General Manager for Europe, Middle East and Africa.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/60a24ba6-aeea-11de-96d7-00144feabdc0.html#axzz2wD2gq890|title=NYSE Euronext picks IBM veteran Cerutti|work=Financial Times|date=}}</ref>
According to his former IBM colleagues, Cerutti starkly contrasted with the company’s generally diffident management style, and preferred to clearly outline strategies for his teams.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usinenouvelle.com/article/dominique-ceruttile-nouveau-profil-d-ibmapres-avoir-conseille-pendant-un-an-lou-gerstner-p-dg-d-ibm-dominique-cerutti-pilote-la-filiale-de-services-informatiques-du-groupe-en-europe.N102980|title=Dominique Cerutti, le nouveau profil d'IBM|work=Usine Nouvelle|date=2001-08-23|language=fr}}</ref>
=== NYSE-Euronext === In 2009 Dominique Cerutti left IBM to join NYSE [[Euronext]], the global exchange group, as President and Deputy CEO. He was also CEO of Euronext NV, the European subsidiary of NYSE Euronext, and Chairman and CEO of Euronext Paris.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/dominique-cerutti/|title=Dominique Cerutti|work=Forbes|date=}}</ref> In 2010, he was appointed as Board Member of the Group.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=a.WEW4C9lqmM|title=NYSE Names Cerutti to Succeed Theodore as Deputy CEO (Update1)|work=Bloomberg|date=2009-10-01}}</ref> He undertook one of his first notable projects as a member of the Board: compliance with the EU’s [[Markets in Financial Instruments Directive]]. According to him, this directive decreased transparency in financial markets by allowing the creation of alternative exchange platforms at a time when “the need for transparence has never been so acute.” <ref>{{Cite web|title = Dominique Cerutti met en garde contre l'opacité des marchés actions|url = http://www.lesechos.fr/29/06/2010/LesEchos/20708-161-ECH_dominique-cerutti-met-en-garde-contre-l-opacite-des-marches-actions.htm|website = lesechos.fr|accessdate = 2015-11-26}}</ref>
In November 2013, he moved up from Deputy CEO of NYSE to become the CEO of Euronext.
In June 2014, he oversaw Euronext’s [[Initial public offering|IPO]] as an independent company after it separated from parent company ICE. As CEO of Euronext, he turned around the strategy of the group, moving away from the legacy of his predecessor, Jean-François Théodore.<ref name=":0" /> In September 2014, he embarked on a program to increase operational savings by €60 million over the next three years, with the goal of achieving a 5% annual revenue growth and improve the company's long-term [[EBITDA]] margin from 42% to 53%.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.thetradenews.com/news/Asset_Classes/Equities/Cerutti_outlines_multi-asset_class_vision_for_Euronext.aspx|title = Cerutti outlines multi-asset class vision for Euronext|date = June 10, 2014|accessdate = October 13, 2014|website = Trade News|publisher = |last = |first = }}</ref>
Cerutti has also spoken against the European Commission's proposal of a [[Financial-transactions tax|financial transactions tax]], arguing that "the political intention of creating such a tax is a noble one, but the current form of the proposal is counter-productive […] this tax is truly the last thing we need now.“<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url = http://www.leadersleague.com/news/view/id/795c276142f14a11e9de0d3977815f34|title = Portrait : Dominique Cerutti, CEO, Euronext|date = September 26, 2014|accessdate = October 13, 2014|website = Leaders League|publisher = |last = |first = |deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141018052436/http://www.leadersleague.com/news/view/id/795c276142f14a11e9de0d3977815f34|archivedate = October 18, 2014|df = }}</ref> He has also spoken out in favor of increased market regulation and transparency as the main way of reducing risk.<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.leadersleague.com/news/view/id/54ab112d5a151b8c5d3293623a9bbff4|title = Dominique Cerutti (Euronext) : "Se repositionner comme un centre majeur de levée de capitaux"|date = September 24, 2014|accessdate = October 13, 2014|website = Leaders League|publisher = |last = |first = |deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20141018052340/http://www.leadersleague.com/news/view/id/54ab112d5a151b8c5d3293623a9bbff4|archivedate = October 18, 2014|df = }}</ref>
During his time as CEO, Euronext once again became independent and had an IPO in its own markets.<ref name=":1" /> According to Rijnhard Van Tets, president of Euronext's Surpervisory Board, "Under his direction, the company was able to successfully re-position itself as the leading independent European stock market." <ref>{{Cite web|title = Dominique Cerutti va quitter Euronext pour diriger Altran|url = http://www.ladepeche.fr/article/2015/04/22/2092196-dominique-cerutti-va-quitter-euronext-pour-diriger-altran.html|website = ladepeche.fr|accessdate = 2015-11-27}}</ref>
=== Altran === Dominique Cerutti has been Chairman and CEO of the [[Altran]] group since 18 June 2015.
In November 2015, Dominique Cerutti announced his five-year strategic plan, "Altran 2020. Ignition." The plan aims for the firm to reach 3 billion euros in revenue in five years and a big increase in profitability.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Altran voit les choses en grand pour 2020|url = http://www.lesechos.fr/tech-medias/hightech/021503433116-altran-voit-les-choses-en-grand-pour-2020-1177808.php?XF5S6o3QZLTYxjph.99|website = lesechos.fr|access-date = 2016-02-01|language = fr-FR}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite web|title = Altran dévoile son plan stratégique : « Altran 2020. Ignition »|url = http://www.altran.fr/actualites/actualites-france/2015/altran-devoile-son-plan-strategique-altran-2020-ignition.html#.Vq8kDfQrKHt|website = www.altran.fr|access-date = 2016-02-01|language = fr|first = |last = }}</ref> As part of the new strategic plan, Dominique Cerrutti launched a strong acquisition policy, notably with Tessella, an international leader in data analysis and data science consulting, Synapse, an American company specialized in developing innovative products, Lohika, a software engineering company and Benteler Engineering, a German firm specialized in design and engineering services for the automobile industry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.zonebourse.com/ALTRAN-TECHNOLOGIES-4610/actualite/Altran-Technologies-finalise-les-acquisitions-de-SWELL-et-de-BENTELER--23563142/|title=Altran Technologies : finalise les acquisitions de SWELL et de BENTELER|publisher=Zone Bourse|date=16 December 2016}}</ref>
Dominique Cerrutti also set up several strategic partnerships, especially in the fields of 3D printing,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://video.lefigaro.fr/figaro/video/dominique-cerutti-avec-l-imprimante-3d-il-sera-possible-de-creer-un-habitat-sur-mars/5021321869001/|title=Dominique Cerutti : "Avec l'imprimante 3D il sera possible de créer un habitat sur Mars"|publisher=Le Figaro}}</ref> with Divergent an American startup that integrates 3D printing with automobile manufacturing,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lepoint.fr/automobile/actualites/impression-3d-pour-l-automobile-altran-investit-dans-divergent-07-09-2016-2066519_683.php|title=Impression 3D pour l'automobile: Altran investit dans Divergent|publisher=Le Point|date=7 September 2016}}</ref> and autonomous driving with EMG (eMApgo) a Chinese company specialized in digital mapping for the automobile industry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lepoint.fr/automobile/actualites/altran-s-allie-avec-une-entreprise-chinoise-specialisee-dans-la-cartographie-numerique-04-01-2017-2094556_683.php|title=Altran s'allie avec une entreprise chinoise spécialisée dans la cartographie numérique|publisher=Le Point|date=4 January 2016}}</ref>
In 2017, he led Altran’s acquisition of Information Risk Management (IRM), a UK-based company specialized in cyber security, as well as GlobalEdge, an India-based software solutions firm specialized in IoT systems and embedded software solutions.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.euroinvestor.fr/actualites/2017/07/28/altran-technologies-altran-acquires-information-risk-management-irm-a-cyber-security-consultancy-based-in-the-uk/13646321|title=ALTRAN TECHNOLOGIES : Altran acquires Information Risk Management (IRM), a Cyber Security consultancy based in the UK|publisher=Euroinvestor|date=28 July 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.consultancy.uk/news/14012/indian-software-services-firm-globaledge-acquired-by-altran|title=Indian software services firm GlobalEdge acquired by Altran|publisher=Consultancy|date=28 September 2017}}</ref>
In November 2017, under the leadership of Dominique Cerruti, Altran Group also purchased the company [[Aricent]] for $2.0 billion, which is to date, the Group’s largest acquisition. This move enabled “Altran 2020. Ignition” strategic plan to achieve its goals two years ahead of schedule and established the company as a world leader in engineering, research and development services.<ref>[http://www.business-standard.com/article/companies/altran-buys-out-aricent-from-kkr-for-2-billion-117113000869_1.html France's Altran buys out Aricent from KKR for $2 bn], Business Standard, December 1, 2017</ref><ref>[https://www.lesechos.fr/tech-medias/hightech/030960044570-altran-change-dechelle-avec-lacquisition-daricent-2134642.php Altran change d'échelle avec l'acquisition d'Aricent], Les Echos, November 30, 2017</ref> Under Cerutti, Altran published revenues for the year 2017 indicating a 10% increase in sales, as well as a current operating income up by 13.6% that year; an increased revenue margin of 10.8%.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/press-releases/2018-02-28/altran-technologies-full-year-results-2017-the-ignition-transformation-bears-its-fruits|title=Full Year results 2017: the "Ignition" transformation bears its fruits|publisher=Bloomberg|date=28 February 2018}}</ref>
In June 2018, Dominique Cerutti announced the plan "The High Road, Altran 2022". This plan ambitions a 14.5% margin and a 4 billion euros turnover in 2022 by betting on technological breakthroughs.<ref>[https://fr.reuters.com/article/businessNews/idFRKBN1JO206-OFRBS Altran vise 14,5% de marge en 2022 en pariant sur les ruptures technologiques], Reuters, june 28, 2018</ref>{{,}}<ref>[https://www.lesechos.fr/tech-medias/hightech/0301893645105-le-plan-daltran-pour-accroitre-ses-revenus-dun-tiers-en-cinq-ans-2188169.php Le plan d'Altran pour accroître ses revenus d'un tiers en cinq ans], les Echos, june 28, 2018</ref>
== Honors & Awards == The French weekly news magazine, ''Option Finance'', named Dominique Cerutti in its ranking of the top 50 newsmakers of 2014.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|title = Les 50 qui ont fait l’actualité en 2014|url = http://www.optionfinance.fr/entreprises-finance/communaute-financiere/les-50-qui-ont-fait-lactualite-en-2014.html|website = www.optionfinance.fr|accessdate = 2015-11-26}}</ref>
== Family background and personal life == Dominique Cerutti is married and the father of two children. He is passionate about jogging and diving.<ref name=":0" />

website = {{URL|http://www.downtownevansville.org/}} | footnotes = }} '''Downtown Evansville''' is the [[central business district]] of [[Evansville, Indiana]]. The boundaries of downtown Evansville have changed as the city has grown, but they are generally considered to be between Canal Street at the south and east, the [[Lloyd Expressway]] to the north, [[Pigeon Creek (Indiana)|Pigeon Creek]] to the northwest, and the [[Ohio River]] to the southeast south and southwest. Downtown Evansville is entirely within [[Pigeon Township, Vanderburgh County, Indiana|Pigeon Township]].
The district constitutes Evansville's government, cultural and business center. The [[Evansville Civic Center Complex|Evansville Civic Center]] houses the administrative offices for the city and [[Vanderburgh County]]. [[Berry Plastics]], [[Vectren]], and [[Old National Bank]], the largest financial services bank holding company headquartered in Indiana,<ref>{{cite web| title=Old National Bank Corporate Profile| publisher=SNL Financial| url=http://www.snl.com/irweblinkx/corporateprofile.aspx?IID=100391|accessdate=2008-10-15}}</ref> have corporate headquarters in downtown Evansville with [[Mead Johnson]]'s headquarters just west of Downtown.
==History== Evansville's original downtown plat was made on about 200 acres, with streets running parallel to the river from northwest to southeast. Other streets nearby were laid out on the cardinal points, due north-south and east-west. Thus, anyone entering or leaving downtown finds that the street makes a confusing oblique-angle turn in one direction or another.<ref>Patry, Robert (1996). ''City of Four Freedoms''. Evansville: Friends of Willard Library. p. 35.</ref>
In the 1970s, the city suffered from problems such as decreased economic activity and suburban flight, but city-sponsored revitalization has since improved downtown conditions.
==Entertainment venues and attractions== [[Victory Theatre]] is a vintage 1,950-seat venue that is home to the [[Evansville Philharmonic Orchestra]] and hosts other concerts and events. A wide variety of concerts, plays, and other special events are held at the 2,500-seat auditorium at [[The Centre (Evansville)|The Centre]]. Downtown is also home to the [[Children's Museum of Evansville]], [[Evansville Museum of Arts, History and Science|Evansville Museum]], and [[Tropicana Evansville|Tropicana]], with the [[USS LST-325|LST-325 Museum]] located just south of Downtown at the nearby Indiana-Kentucky State Line. The [[Ford Center (Evansville)|Ford Center]] is a new arena opened in 2011 located near [[The Centre (Evansville)|The Centre]].

Dylan R. Berry (born October 30, 1974) is an American music producer, composer, radio host and entertainment entrepreneur, best known as a music producer and composer. Berry has managed, published and produced hundreds of hours of media music for top-rated television shows including the [[Academy Awards]], [[American Idol]], [[So You Think You Can Dance]], [[Scream Queens (2008 TV series)|Scream Queens]] and the [[MTV Video Music Award|MTV Music Awards]].<ref name="IMDb">{{cite web|title=Dylan Berry (II)|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2090271/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1|website=IMDb|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref> He has created branded music for over 7 major networks including [[Starz]], [[Time Warner Cable SportsChannel|Time Warner Sportsnet]], [[Time Warner Cable News|Time Warner News Network]], [[Root Sports|Root Sports Network]], [[SportsCenter|ESPN Sports Center]] and all 10 of the [[Encore (TV network)|Encore Network]] stations, for which Berry won a Hollywood Music in Media Award.<ref name="HMMA">{{cite web|title=2014 HMMA Winners|url=http://www.hmmawards.com/hmma-winners/|website=Hollywood Music in Media Awards|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref> Berry has also composed and coordinated music for the [[Academy Awards|Oscars]], Spike Awards, [[Victoria's Secret Fashion Show|Victoria Secret Fashion Shows]] and many more.<ref name="IMDb" />
== Career ==
=== Hollowstone Music === From 2001 to 2009, Berry was President and Owner of Hollowstone Music, where he composed music for television channels such as [[History (U.S. TV channel)|History]] and [[National Geographic Channel|National Geographic]]. Under Hollowstone Music, Dylan wrote over 100 hours of music alongside his business partner, Noah Lifschey. The company was later sold in 2009.<ref name="Linkedin">{{cite web|title=Dylan Berry|url=https://www.linkedin.com/in/therealdylanberry|website=LinkedIn|accessdate=9 February 2016}}</ref>
=== Levels Music Group === Following Hollowstone Music, Dylan launched Levels Music Group, a partnership with [http://www.levelsaudio.com/ Levels Audio], where he composed music for television and award shows including The Academy Awards, American Idol, So You Think You Can Dance, The Sing-Off, Surviving the Cut, Downfall, the Comedy Central Roast Series, The MTV Music Awards and many others.<ref name="Linkedin" />
=== Smash Haus Music Group ===
Dylan Berry is listed in the top 1% "most prolific" composers in media music on IMDB and has composed music for 30+ TV Networks including Time Warner Sportsnet, Time Warner News, Encore, Starz, ESPN Sportscenter and more.
Berry currently owns and operates [http://www.smashhaus.com Smash Haus Music Group], a company which deploys proprietary technologies throughout the media industry providing original music at scale for media production companies for use in media, television and branded content.
He is credited with providing music for television shows and specials including [[Academy Awards]], [[American Idol]], [[So You Think You Can Dance]] [[Here Comes Honey Boo Boo]] [[America's Got Talent]], [[Amish Mafia]], Kevin Hart's [[Kevin Hart: Laugh at My Pain|Laugh at My Pain]], [[The Sing Off (TV series)|The Sing Off]] and [[America's Best Dance Crew]], among others.<ref name="IMDb" />
=== Noiz Society === Dylan Berry is also founder of Noiz Society, [http://www.noizsociety.com] an exclusive group, secret society of famous and influential talent, industry and entrepreneurs in the music industry</ref>
=== Record Production Work === Berry is an Aria Nominated, Mark Award and Hollywood Music in Media Award-winning record producer.
Currently a member of the trip hop, dub revival group Frivolous Drivel with Greco Rossetti.
Former partner and founder of the production team, [http://www.filthyfidgets.com The Filthy Fidgets] with business partner and co-producer Stefan Litrownik. Together the team is credited with producing for notable acts such as [[Imagine Dragons]], [[One Direction]], [[Andy Grammer]], The Living End, Verdine White of [[Earth, Wind & Fire]], [[Emblem3]] and [[Billy Ray Cyrus]].<ref name="Filthy Fidgets">{{cite web|title=Artists|url=http://filthy-fidgets-music.squarespace.com/gdjqmg2bp63sr9dox4t09eex0n4cau|website=Filthy Fidgets|accessdate=3 February 2016}}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
=== Bompop Media === Bompop Media is a media production company in Hollywood, California that produces high-impact, celebrity and industry-based, behind-the scenes-media for TV, web and radio. Bompop Media syndicates this content globally through a network of strategic partners in the social and content creator space.
Berry is the host and founder of Bompop Media, which broadcasts BompopTV & Bompopradio a weekly influencer and industry-related talk show that features celebrity talent, supports emerging talent while exploring the roots to realities of working in Hollywood and the Entertainment industry. Bompopradio is a partnership with collaborator, TV personality and notable influencer DJ Skee, who was voted by Forbes and Rolling Stone Magazine as one of the most influential tastemakers in music and media.<ref name="Forbes">{{cite web|last1=Greenburg|first1=Zack|title=30 Under 30 In Music: Honorable Mentions|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/zackomalleygreenburg/2011/12/21/30-under-30-in-music-honorable-mentions/2/#4799610f43e3|website=Forbes|accessdate=3 February 2016}}</ref>
In early 2016, Bompopradio transitioned to BompopTV, an audiovisual web series which explores the depths and realities of leading creators, personalities and tastemakers in music and entertainment. Later that year, Berry was awarded 3 YouTube Silver play buttons. He also ranked in the top 1% most prolific contributors on IMDB with over 500+ Film and TV credits.
Dylan hosted 2016 and 2017 Hollywood Music in Media Awards of which he had one two years earlier for his work on Encore Network Theme Packages.
== Influences == Berry cites [[Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band]] by [[The Beatles]] as a huge inspiration for his creative life specifically, but also mentions his general love for hip-hop and rock music as key influences in his career.

[[Data mining]], the process of discovering patterns in large [[data set]]s, has been used in many applications.
==Games== Since the early 1960s, with the availability of [[Oracle machine|oracles]] for certain [[combinatorial game]]s, also called [[tablebase]]s (e.g. for 3x3-chess) with any beginning configuration, small-board [[dots-and-boxes]], small-board-hex, and certain endgames in chess, dots-and-boxes, and hex; a new area for data mining has been opened. This is the extraction of human-usable strategies from these oracles. Current pattern recognition approaches do not seem to fully acquire the high level of abstraction required to be applied successfully. Instead, extensive experimentation with the tablebases – combined with an intensive study of tablebase-answers to well designed problems, and with knowledge of prior art (i.e., pre-tablebase knowledge) – is used to yield insightful patterns. [[Berlekamp]] (in dots-and-boxes, etc.) and [[John Nunn]] (in [[chess]] [[Chess endgame|endgames]]) are notable examples of researchers doing this work, though they were not – and are not – involved in tablebase generation.
==Business==
In business, data mining is the analysis of historical business activities, stored as static data in data warehouse databases. The goal is to reveal hidden patterns and trends. Data mining software uses advanced [[Pattern recognition|pattern recognition algorithms]] to sift through large amounts of data to assist in discovering previously unknown strategic business information. Examples of what businesses use data mining for is to include performing market analysis to identify new product bundles, finding the root cause of manufacturing problems, to prevent [[customer attrition]] and acquire new customers, [[cross-selling]] to existing customers, and profiling customers with more accuracy.<ref>O'Brien, J. A., & Marakas, G. M. (2011). Management Information Systems. New York, NY: McGraw-Hill/Irwin.</ref> * In today’s world raw data is being collected by companies at an exploding rate. For example, Walmart processes over 20 million point-of-sale transactions every day. This information is stored in a centralized database, but would be useless without some type of data mining software to analyze it. If Walmart analyzed their point-of-sale data with data mining techniques they would be able to determine sales trends, develop marketing campaigns, and more accurately predict customer loyalty.<ref>Alexander, D. (n.d.). Data Mining. Retrieved from The University of Texas at Austin: College of Liberal Arts: http://www.laits.utexas.edu/~anorman/BUS.FOR/course.mat/Alex/</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Daniele Medri: Big Data & Business: An on-going revolution|url=http://www.statisticsviews.com/details/feature/5393251/Big-Data--Business-An-on-going-revolution.html|publisher=[[Statistics Views]]|date=21 Oct 2013}}</ref> One such example for Walmart would be that of diapers and beer sales, discovered through data mining.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/2006/08/15/beer_diapers/|title=The parable of the beer and diapers|access-date=2018-02-18|language=en}}</ref> * Categorization of the items available in the e-commerce site is a fundamental problem. A correct item categorization system is essential for user experience as it helps determine the items relevant to him for search and browsing. Item categorization can be formulated as a supervised classification problem in data mining where the categories are the target classes and the features are the words composing some textual description of the items. One of the approaches is to find groups initially which are similar and place them together in a latent group. Now given a new item, first classify into a latent group which is called coarse level classification. Then, do a second round of classification to find the category to which the item belongs to.<ref>{{Cite web|url =http://labs.ebay.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Jean-David-Ruvini-Large-scale_Item.pdf|title =Large Scale Item Categorization|date =|accessdate =|website =|publisher =|last =|first =|deadurl =yes|archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20151005215055/http://labs.ebay.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Jean-David-Ruvini-Large-scale_Item.pdf|archivedate =2015-10-05|df =}}</ref> * Every time a credit card or a store loyalty card is being used, or a warranty card is being filled, data is being collected about the user's behavior. Many people find the amount of information stored about us from companies, such as Google, Facebook, and Amazon, disturbing and are concerned about privacy. Although there is the potential for our personal data to be used in harmful, or unwanted, ways it is also being used to make our lives better. For example, Ford and Audi hope to one day collect information about customer driving patterns so they can recommend safer routes and warn drivers about dangerous road conditions.<ref name="macon.com">Goss, S. (2013, April 10). Data-mining and our personal privacy. Retrieved from The Telegraph: {{cite web |url=http://www.macon.com/2013/04/10/2429775/data-mining-and-our-personal-privacy.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-09-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140705055127/http://www.macon.com/2013/04/10/2429775/data-mining-and-our-personal-privacy.html |archivedate=2014-07-05 |df= }}</ref> * Data mining in [[customer relationship management]] applications can contribute significantly to the bottom line.{{Citation needed|date=July 2008}} Rather than randomly contacting a prospect or customer through a call center or sending mail, a company can concentrate its efforts on prospects that are predicted to have a high likelihood of responding to an offer. More sophisticated methods may be used to optimize resources across campaigns so that one may predict to which channel and to which offer an individual is most likely to respond (across all potential offers). Additionally, sophisticated applications could be used to automate mailing. Once the results from data mining (potential prospect/customer and channel/offer) are determined, this "sophisticated application" can either automatically send an e-mail or a regular mail. Finally, in cases where many people will take an action without an offer, "[[uplift modelling|uplift modeling]]" can be used to determine which people have the greatest increase in response if given an offer. Uplift modeling thereby enables marketers to focus mailings and offers on persuadable people, and not to send offers to people who will buy the product without an offer. [[Data clustering]] can also be used to automatically discover the segments or groups within a customer data set. * Businesses employing data mining may see a return on investment, but also they recognize that the number of predictive models can quickly become very large. For example, rather than using one model to predict how many customers will [[Churn rate|churn]], a business may choose to build a separate model for each region and customer type. In situations where a large number of models need to be maintained, some businesses turn to more automated data mining methodologies. * Data mining can be helpful to human resources (HR) departments in identifying the characteristics of their most successful employees. In simple terms, it aims to find out how the changes in an individual's DNA sequence affects the risks of developing common diseases such as [[cancer]], which is of great importance to improving methods of diagnosing, preventing, and treating these diseases.
